subject: 24 Red Hot Stocks Under 24 Bucks
body:
24 Red Hot Stocks Under 24 Bucks




We love giving our InvestorPlace.com members benefits like access to this timely message.  
 In order to ensure you keep receiving special alerts and offers like this one, please take a moment to click on any of the links in this message to reconfirm that this is the email address where you want to receive emails from InvestorPlace.com   
                 












Fellow colleague,
The average price of an S&P 500 stock today is over $70.
Obviously, building a portfolio of just 100 shares of 50 S&P stocks at $70 per share takes considerable resources! (If you’re into math: $350,000!)
That’s why one question I get asked a lot is: Louis do you EVER recommend CHEAPER stocks?





Left Behind


If
the Dow had kept up with the S&P Small-Cap Index over the last 8
years, the Dow would stand today, not at 13,000, but at 27,000! And
lots of conservative investors would have twice the wealth! 
It isn’t too late to catch up, as you’ll learn in this report. 




The
answer is yes absolutely! Indeed, this is an especially good time to
buy lower-priced stocks. You see, as the blue chips rise, their
cheaper, smaller brethren soar.

Indeed,
since January, smaller-cap, lower-priced stocks are outpacing the Dow
stocks by 50%. And for the last decade, lower priced stocks have out
performed the Dow by 7-to-1.
Why?
Smaller lower priced stocks have been able to grow earnings at warp speed!
Unencumbered
by legacy concerns such as pension liabilities and a unionized labor
force, management can focus on responding to market demands.
That’s why the stocks I recommend in Emerging Growth have just posted 150% annual earnings growth on average this quarter!
Just
compare that to the 9% average growth of the S&P 500 and you’ll see
why the smaller, lower-priced guys are zooming ahead!
I recommend a portfolio of lower priced (not low-priced, as I’ll explain in a moment) stocks today especially because:

the Fed is likely to cut rates this year, igniting a big boom in smaller stocks generally
merger mania is sweeping the market, and smaller companies are being snapped up at big premiums
And
the digitization of the exchanges has shrunk the bid/ask spread to a
point where lower-priced stocks are hyper-responsive to buying pressure.

The Case AGAINST
											These Stocks




Emerging Growth
																BAGS DOUBLERS,
																TRIPLERS AND QUADRUPLERS
																UNDER $24
Just in the past year, our system has correctly identified these low-priced winners:

You are already familiar with my research, so you know: I hate uncontrollable risk. And stocks under $5 or $10, listed on the Pink Sheets or the Vancouver Exchanges, are my definition of out-of-control risk!
Most of the time, I’d rather juggle chainsaws at a baby shower.
Let me show you the four keys to success with lower priced stocks.
KEY #1: Nothing under $4, nothing over $24. Stocks under $4 are hockey pucks for the traders and we’re not traders here at Emerging Growth.
Over $24 and these companies are just a little beyond the inflection
point in their growth. But in between, you’ve probably found a company
that’s out of the garage—but still under the radar.

Think: Dell at $11 in September, 1990, which is when Emerging Growth subscribers snapped it up. Then think about the $22,000,000 that a $100,000 grub stake in Dell would have become. Got the idea? Ok, let’s look at…

KEY #2. Extremely strong sales growth.
Nothing less than 50% will do here—and 100% is better. Why? This rate
of sales growth signifies market acceptance. By their nature, these are
innovative companies, but we don’t want the RISKS of innovation
(especially the waiting!).

Example:
Apple spent $500 million on the ill-fated Newton PDA before it was
pulled off the shelves. That made Apple a dangerously expensive stock
at $9, which is where it languished for most of the decade before the
iPod era.
But when the iPod sales kicked in, we bought—and rode the stock up to $85.

KEY #3. Exploding margins. The stocks I’ve uncovered in Emerging Growth
are currently improving operating margin at a 200% clip—or close. This
means that the strong sales are not being bought at too high a price.

Example:
We were impressed with Hansen Natural soft drinks business when it was
a $4 stock, posting sales that were doubling. But the clincher was the
rate at which Hansen was growing its margins in 2004-—Emerging Growth subscribers have multiplied their money 10 TIMES since then.

KEY #4. The Holy Grail: earnings growth. Expanding operating earnings generally lead to earnings growth going at warp-speed.
A
good clue here is to track how analysts are revising their consumers
earnings estimates. The more they do this, and the bigger their
adjustments, the more you can be certain that the stock will pop on
earnings surprise at the end of the quarter—and hand you windfall
profits.

Example:
Holly, the refinery, was a $12 stock with 105% sales growth and profit
margins doubling when we bought it. Analysts were so befuddled, they
couldn’t revise their earnings growth numbers fast enough. That’s when
we knew we had to step in. The stock’s up over 400% since.

These are our 4 keys to success with lower-priced stocks.
When you join us here at Emerging Growth I will send you a just-completed report on the lower-priced stocks that are now ready for their big run. The report is called 24 Lower-Priced Doublers for 2007. And what’s more—it’s FREE. Just click the button here:
Let me tell you about a few of these gems right now (complete details in your report, of course):
Invest With
											The Masters
Pentagon
code-breaker and math wizard Jim Simons earned $1.7 billion last year
in fees. That works out at about $680,000 an hour.

How have Emerging Growth subscribers done recently in lower-priced stocks?

This
list is taken from our current buy list. If I listed all the Under-$24
stocks we’ve made at least a double in, using these same 4 simple criteria,
it could take up the next 3 pages—and exhaust your patience. Take it
from me: Emerging Growth became the #1 advisory for 20 years on stocks
under $24 that matched my 4 exclusive keys.




Want to know how he did it?
His hedge fund locked up an 84% gain in 2006.
Which makes you wonder: What’s Jim buying now?
Answer: A lot of one tiny company stock that Emerging Growth subscribers were snapping up before him, at around $12. (It’s still at $14.)
What is attracting the attention of a super-quant, crypto-analyst genius?
Fat
In particular, the fat on your hips and especially the fat on your stomach, where it is most liable to cause a heart attack.
A
tiny company (144 employees) in St. Paul, Minnesota has made a
breakthrough in diagnosing and managing heart attack risks. The
diagnostic piece of the business opens a big opportunity, but it is the
risk-management piece that is genuinely thrilling.
It’s
no secret that heart problems are linked to weight, but until now no
one has been able to really help ordinary people get the weight off—and
keep it off.
This is a quest that has ALREADY made scores of Emerging Growth
subscribers, all over the country, very rich. You see, NutriSystem,
which delivers every meal to your home, is a fantastic idea. The stock
was $20 when we bought it and it just flew through our filters. Emerging Growth subscribers are up 217% in short order in NutriSystem.
But this new weight-loss system should do even better—because the solution is based on personalized feedback as you go through your exercise routine.
How Does It
											Work?
Three
weeks ago and, I’d guess, with Jim Simons’ billions, this tiny
diagnostics company hooked up with Garmin, the GPS people. Now Garmin
is a company that is likely to do for GPS what Apple did for MP3s, make
no mistake.
Garmin
has a fitness device for a niche group of running enthusiasts, but by
hooking it up to our company’s metabolic training program, it gives you
voice-guided instructions to encourage you through a personalized
routine.
Well, even I’d give THAT a try (and I’m allergic to exercise!).
And when it hits the market, I bet millions of people will say the same!
Let’s Look At
											The Numbers


Sales growth: 53%
Earnings growth: 550% in the past 4 quarters
Operating margins: tripled
Selling at: 19 times forecasted earnings
PEG Ratio: a microscopic 0.04
Potential: $25 in 6 – 9 months—a double

 You don’t have to be a math genius like Jim Simons to figure—this is a screaming buy.
 Details in your FREE report.
 Want More?
 In your FREE report, 24 Lower-Priced Doublers for 2007, I also give you the skinny on:

the seismic surveyor that specializes in “gentle” exploration in
environmentally sensitive areas. Sales growth: up 135%. Earnings
growth: up 900%, thanks to rapidly expanding operating margins.
Analysts are scrambling to revise estimates higher, so look for a big
surprise when earnings are released. This is a $9 stock, with a
Price-to-Earning ratio of 9, packing a 900% earnings growth. They just
don’t make a lot of these!

The laboratory that cuts down on one of the leading causes of death—the
medicines themselves. Over 120,000 deaths a year are the result of
drugs’ unique effect on women, children and the elderly. Now this lab
has a way of predicting the effect on different patient-groups. Sales
growth: up 78%. Earnings growth: up 140%. Snap it up under $11 if you
can (be careful—follow instructions so you don’t chase it away!). The
stock’s up over 400% since September, but earnings growth has kept pace
sufficiently to make this STILL a bargain.

 





“Just think: you could command a portfolio of doublers like this—for under $5,000!”
																		—Louis Navellier



This pocket rocket develops hacker-proof security systems for big clients. It only has 184 employees and most of the stock is locked up in institutional portfolios but this is the best
company in a fantastic growth area. Sales growth: 93%. Earnings growth:
more than quadrupled—up 333%. Analysts were embarrassingly wide of the
mark. Amazingly, this is still a $22 stock—but it’s on its way to being
$40 this year.

 I Know Where Of
											I Speak




LOOK AT THIS!
Emerging Growth is where you would have made


786% in 18 months in 4 Kids Entertainment

963% in 15 months in Go2Net


and scores more, all up over 500%






The
24 stocks under $24 I recommend in your report all have a similar
potential to Hansen Natural, which we bought—STOLE, I should say—at
$3.29. That one could have made you 8,000% richer.
Just ask my Emerging Growth subscribers.
 And while you’re at it ask them, please, about Iris International (up 3,248%) and Amedysis (up 3,181%).
 Ask them about Chico’s FAS (up 2,367%), Quality Systems (up 2,142%) and Holly (up 1,752%).
 And
don’t forget to ask my Emerging Growth subscribers about NutriSystem
(bought at $20.12), which is, as we speak, a TRIPLE for us.
 As
you can see, lower priced stocks give you easy access to big gains.
Gains that could amount to 42,000%—which is what our Buy List has
achieved over the last 27 years!
 Join us at Emerging Growth now and receive, FREE, 24 Lower Priced Doublers for 2007.
Today, investors want more. They’re finding it in low-priced stocks. The best ones are in Emerging Growth.
 
Louis Navellier, Editor
Emerging Growth
“#1 for 20 years, 1985 - 2005”
 P.S.
IT’S A SECRET. I don’t know of ANY analyst on Wall Street who’s figured
out that quant genius Jim Simons and his billions are behind our weight
management stock. It’s a stunning move—and it makes this $14 stock
worth double, overnight.
											P.P.S. YOURS TODAY ONLY. You get 24 Lower-Priced Doublers for 2007 FREE when you join us today. This offer is available TODAY. Just click on the button here.
